commitResults.messageTitle: Ignore binary files in revision control
Rename chatbot to Xenon
Implement chatbot skeleton to greet user and exit
Add support for echo
Separate chatbot into a class
Add support for list
Create Task class to represent tasks
Add support for marking task as done
replace if-else chain with separate if blocks for readability
Add markAsDone and markAsNotDone methods to Task
commitResults.messageBody:
Encapsulated state changes within Task instead of modifying its fields
externally from Xenon, hence following the "Tell, don't ask" principle.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for changing tasks status back to not done
Create ToDoTask, DeadLineTask and Event subclasses extending Task
commitResults.messageBody:
These subclasses encapsulate specific task types, allowing different behaviour
and attributes for general tasks, deadlines, and events while reusing Task functionality.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for different types of task
Extract chat logic into smaller helper methods for readability
commitResults.messageBody:
Moved individual command handling (list, mark, unmark, todo, deadline, event)
into separate methods. This simplifies the main chat loop, making it
easier to read and maintain.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases for chatbot command
Add error handling for invalid user inputs
Make the error handling more error-specific.
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce a new `help` command to display a list of all supported commands and their correct syntax.
Add a general assistance message to all error output, encouraging users to find solutions on their own.
These changes improves the overall user experience on the chatbot.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases for invalid user input
Replace Array with Arraylist for simpler data manipulation
Add support for Delete
Add test cases for delete
Replace command if-blocks with Command enum
commitResults.messageBody:
Commands now store their keyword, usage, and description. The userGuide method
generates a formatted guide automatically.
This centralizes command logic, improves readability, simplifies adding new commands,
and ensures the help text stays up-to-date without manual changes.
